January 1944.Copy No.WAR CABINET.COMMITTEE ON " OVERLORD " PREPARATIONS.Note by the Prime Minister.I propose to hold a weekly meeting to speed, up and stimulate 'c Overlord "preparations in all aspects other than tactical and strategic, and to review and adjust their impact on war programmes and on the civil life of the community.2. These meetings will normally be held on Wednesday at 6 p.m. at no. 10 Downing Street. The meetings of the Anti-U-Boat Committee, previouslyheld on this day, will, in future, be held every two months.3. The Committee under the Chairmanship of the Minister of Production,set up by the War Cabinet at their meeting on the 17th January, to deal primarily with Inland Transport and the effect thereon of " Overlord " preparations, willcontinue. The reports of this Committee, and of any other body which raisesbroad issues of principle as to the repercussions of the " Overlord " preparations,will be brought before the new Committee at the regular weekly meetings.4. My intention is that the permanent panel of the Committee should bea small nucleus of the Ministers directly concerned, who will attend all the meet-ings. Other Ministers, who will be concerned in many, but not all the mattersraised, will receive all the Committee's papers and minutes and will attend meetings, or send representatives, as may be appropriate.The permanent panel will be as follows : Prime Minister (Chairman).Lord President.Home Secretary and Minister of Home Security.Minister of Labour and National Service.Minister of Production.First Lord of the Admiralty.Secretary of State for War.Secretary of State for Air.Lord Privy Seal.Paymaster-General.SECRET.W.P. (44) 68.31.^ January, 1944. The following Ministers will receive all the Committee's papers and minuteand will attend as appropriate : Minister of Supply:Minister of War Transport.Minister of Aircraft Production.President of the Board of Trade.Minister of Health.Minister of Food.Minister of Works.Minister of Fuel and Power.Minister of Information.Chairman of the Oil Control Board (Mr. Lloyd).W.
